segments.source_content: Hi everyone!

segments.source_content: This week we have many great React articles and a few interesting releases. It seems that React is constantly being criticized, but overall, the arguments are always the same and many of them seems a bit outdated, and never acknowledging what React does better than other solutions.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, nous avons de nombreux excellents articles React et quelques sorties intÃ©ressantes. Il semble que React soit constamment critiquÃ©, mais globalement, les arguments sont toujours les mÃªmes et beaucoup semblent un peu dÃ©passÃ©s, sans jamais reconnaÃ®tre ce que React fait mieux que les autres solutions.
translations.en: Cette semaine, nous avons de nombreux articles passionnants sur React et quelques sorties intÃ©ressantes. Bien que React soit constamment critiquÃ©, les arguments restent gÃ©nÃ©ralement les mÃªmes et semblent souvent un peu dÃ©passÃ©s, sans jamais reconnaÃ®tre ce que React fait mieux que les autres solutions.

segments.source_content: Million is an optimizing compiler for React. This new major version is a complete rewrite that fixes caveats of previous versions, handles more edge cases, brings a new optimized hydration system and improves stability.

translations.fr: Million est un compilateur d'optimisation pour React. Cette nouvelle version majeure est une rÃ©Ã©criture complÃ¨te qui corrige les limitations des versions prÃ©cÃ©dentes, gÃ¨re plus de cas limites, apporte un nouveau systÃ¨me d'hydratation optimisÃ© et amÃ©liore la stabilitÃ©.
translations.en: Million est un compilateur d'optimisation pour React. Cette nouvelle version majeure est une rÃ©Ã©criture complÃ¨te qui corrige les limites des versions prÃ©cÃ©dentes, gÃ¨re plus de cas particuliers, apporte un nouveau systÃ¨me d'hydratation optimisÃ© et amÃ©liore la stabilitÃ©.

segments.source_content: It looks like Million is planning to help us debug and maintain great web performance over time. According to their ğŸ¦ [launch trailer](https://twitter.com/aidenybai/status/1753456530652107072), a million linter is on the roadmap.

translations.fr: Il semble que Million prÃ©voie de nous aider Ã  dÃ©boguer et Ã  maintenir une excellente performance web au fil du temps. Selon leur ğŸ¦ [bande-annonce de lancement](https://twitter.com/aidenybai/status/1753456530652107072), un linter million est prÃ©vu.
translations.en: Il semble que Million prÃ©voie de nous aider Ã  dÃ©boguer et Ã  maintenir d'excellentes performances web au fil du temps. Selon leur ğŸ¦ [bande-annonce de lancement](https://twitter.com/aidenybai/status/1753456530652107072), un linter million est prÃ©vu dans le roadmap.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Product for Engineers - PostHog's newsletter helping engineers build their product skills.](https://newsletter.posthog.com/?utm_source=twir&utm_campaign=twir)
- ğŸ‘€ [React Types PR - JSDoc comments](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/68409): Matt Pocock is working on increasing our DX when using React with TypeScript.
- ğŸ“œ [Avoid using Reactâ€™s `useFormStatus`](https://allanlasser.com/posts/2024-01-26-avoid-using-reacts-useformstatus): An interesting article presenting shortcomings of this new React hook. It requires to be used under a `<form>` element, yet placing a submit `<button>` outside a form is perfectly valid HTML. Suggests using an async transition as an alternative.
- ğŸ“œ [Direction-aware animations in Framer Motion](https://sinja.io/blog/direction-aware-animations-in-framer-motion): A pleasant interactive article showing how to animate list/details views and carousel slides in the correct direction for enter/exist animations.
- ğŸ“œ [Open Sourcing the Remix Website](https://remix.run/blog/oss-remix-dot-run): The Remix team think there are more benefits than drawbacks to open-source their website. You can now study how their homepage scroll experience is implemented, or how they SSR their docs pages.
- ğŸ“œ [Dockerizing a Next.js Application with GitHub Actions](https://mxd.codes/articles/ci-cd-for-nextjs-with-github-actions): Builds the default Dockerfile provided by Vercel with appropriate env variables, and publishes it to your container registry.
- ğŸ“œ [Removing React is just weakness leaving your codebase](https://begin.com/blog/posts/2024-01-26-removing-react-is-just-weakness-leaving-your-codebase): Interesting criticism I canâ€™t really agree with ğŸ˜… to me React doesnâ€™t change that often, existing code doesnâ€™t need to be rewritten and CSS-in-JS, well we know runtime-based libs are a problem for a whileâ€¦ And even React devs today rely more and more on web fundamentals than ever.
- ğŸ“œ [It feels like React is getting a bit of a kicking recently](https://piccalil.li/blog/react-is-getting-a-bit-of-a-kicking-recently/): A more nuanced reply to the criticism above. React isnâ€™t perfect, but isnâ€™t going anywhere, and the web platform doesnâ€™t currently give us all the tools we need.
- ğŸ“œ [How to stream files from Next.js Route Handlers](https://www.ericburel.tech/blog/nextjs-stream-files): Shows how to serve dynamic/generated files without loading them in memory. You might need to convert Node.js streams to web streams.
- ğŸ“œ [How to Detect Clicks Anywhere on a Page in React](https://spacejelly.dev/posts/how-to-detect-clicks-anywhere-on-a-page-in-react): TIL about the event.composedPath() API.
- ğŸ“œ [How streaming helps build faster web applications](https://vercel.com/blog/how-streaming-helps-build-faster-web-applications)
- ğŸ“œ [Lessons Learned from Developing DevCycle's Next.js SDK](https://blog.devcycle.com/feature-flagging-with-next-js-lessons-learned-from-developing-devcycles-sdk/): Their feature-flag SDK had to support Server/Client Components, streaming and Suspense.
- ğŸ“œ [How to generate responsive images on Remix with Unpic](https://unpic.pics/blog/responsive-images-on-remix/)
- ğŸ“œ [Enhance Your React App's Scalability using Storybook and Chromatic](https://dainemawer.com/articles/enhance-your-react-apps-scalability-using-storybook-and-chromatic)
- ğŸ“œ [Tale of a Refactor - Payment system](https://commerce.nearform.com/blog/2024/tale-of-a-refactor/)
- ğŸ“œ [How we Increased Search Traffic by 20x in 4 Months with the Next.js App Router](https://hardcover.app/blog/next-js-app-router-seo)
- ğŸ“œ [How I generate Open Graph images for my Astro-based blog](https://techsquidtv.com/blog/generating-open-graph-images-for-astro/)
- ğŸ“œ [Building a blog with Next.js App Router and MDX](https://www.alexchantastic.com/building-a-blog-with-next-and-mdx)
- ğŸ“œ [React Intersection Observer - A Practical Guide](https://www.builder.io/blog/react-intersection-observer)
- ğŸ“¦ [Storybook 8 Beta - RSC support, SWC compiler, Vitest, major performance and compatibility improvements, on-the-fly visual testsâ€¦](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-8-beta/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Conform 1.0 - Type-safe progressive enhancement form validation library for Remix and Next.js](https://github.com/edmundhung/conform/releases/tag/v1.0.0)

- ğŸ“¦ [Apollo Client 3.9 - Suspense data-fetching, query preloading, memory optimizations, useQueryRefHandlers hookâ€¦](https://www.apollographql.com/blog/whats-new-in-apollo-client-3-9)

- ğŸ“¦ [Sonner 1.4 - Toast component](https://github.com/emilkowalski/sonner/releases/tag/v1.4.0)

Il existe deux approches diffÃ©rentes (ğŸ¦ [comparaison cÃ´te Ã  cÃ´te](https://twitter.com/o_kwasniewski/status/1754520654219493408)) pour intÃ©grer React Native Ã  visionPro :
translations.en: La semaine derniÃ¨re, Apple a lancÃ© son Apple Vision Pro, et au moins une partie de la communautÃ© React Native est enthousiaste Ã  l'idÃ©e d'une nouvelle plateforme sur laquelle elle pourra crÃ©er des expÃ©riences avec son framework prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©. Il existe deux approches diffÃ©rentes (ğŸ¦ [comparaison cÃ´te Ã  cÃ´te](https://twitter.com/o_kwasniewski/status/1754520654219493408)) pour amener React Native sur visionPro :

segments.source_content:
- Similar to how you can run an iOS app on macOS you can check a box in App Store Connect and enable your app to run on visionOS â€œas is,â€ using compatibility mode. Check out how ğŸ¦ [Evan Bacon provisions, builds, and installs an Expo app on visionPro in under 10 minutes](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1753927218697208102). Apps in compatibility mode donâ€™t take advantage of the â€œspatial computingâ€ capabilities of visionOS though, theyâ€™re merely an iPad screen shown in the room.

- To build apps that are truly optimized for this new world, additional native capabilities need to be adapted. And that is exactly what this new visionOS platform is doing, driven by Oskar KwaÅ›niewski and brought to us by Callstack.

translations.fr:
- Comme vous pouvez exÃ©cuter une application iOS sur macOS, vous pouvez cocher une case dans App Store Connect et activer votre application pour qu'elle s'exÃ©cute sur visionOS Â« tel quel Â», en utilisant le mode de compatibilitÃ©. DÃ©couvrez comment ğŸ¦ [Evan Bacon provisionne, construit et installe une application Expo sur visionPro en moins de 10 minutes](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1753927218697208102). Les applications en mode de compatibilitÃ© ne tirent cependant pas parti des capacitÃ©s de Â« calcul spatial Â» de visionOS, elles ne sont qu'un Ã©cran iPad affichÃ© dans la piÃ¨ce.

- Pour crÃ©er des applications vÃ©ritablement optimisÃ©es pour ce nouveau monde, des capacitÃ©s natives supplÃ©mentaires doivent Ãªtre adaptÃ©es. Et c'est exactement ce que fait cette nouvelle plateforme visionOS, dirigÃ©e par Oskar KwaÅ›niewski et proposÃ©e par Callstack.

- Similairement Ã  la faÃ§on dont vous pouvez exÃ©cuter une application iOS sur macOS, vous pouvez cocher une case dans App Store Connect et activer votre application pour qu'elle s'exÃ©cute sur visionOS "tel quel", en utilisant le mode de compatibilitÃ©. DÃ©couvrez comment ğŸ¦ [Evan Bacon provisionne, construit et installe une application Expo sur visionPro en moins de 10 minutes](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1753927218697208102). Les applications en mode compatibilitÃ© ne tirent cependant pas parti des capacitÃ©s de "calcul spatial" de visionOS, elles ne sont qu'un Ã©cran iPad affichÃ© dans la piÃ¨ce.

- Pour crÃ©er des applications vÃ©ritablement optimisÃ©es pour ce nouveau monde, des capacitÃ©s natives supplÃ©mentaires doivent Ãªtre adaptÃ©es. Et c'est exactement ce que fait cette nouvelle plateforme visionOS, menÃ©e par Oskar KwaÅ›niewski et proposÃ©e par Callstack.

segments.source_content: Itâ€™s early days, but it's super exciting to see RN embrace a new platform so quickly! The very first React Native visionOS app [Spacial Noise](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/spatial-noise/id6477335349) is already available on the App Store.

translations.fr: Ce n'est que le dÃ©but, mais c'est trÃ¨s excitant de voir RN adopter une nouvelle plateforme aussi rapidement ! La toute premiÃ¨re application React Native visionOS [Spacial Noise](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/spatial-noise/id6477335349) est dÃ©jÃ  disponible sur l'App Store.
translations.en: C'est encore le dÃ©but, mais c'est trÃ¨s excitant de voir RN adopter une nouvelle plateforme aussi rapidement ! La toute premiÃ¨re application visionOS React Native [Spacial Noise](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/spatial-noise/id6477335349) est dÃ©jÃ  disponible sur l'App Store.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Moropo - Mobile Testing Infrastructure That Integrates Seamlessly With Expo EAS ](https://www.moropo.com?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=emails&utm_campaign=twir-20240207)
- ğŸ‘€ [RFC - React Native Frameworks](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals/pull/759): Did you ever wonder where the boundary between React Native, Expo, and other community tools is? Lines are blurry, and this RFC aims to clarify things by introducing the concept of â€œReact Native Frameworks.â€
- ğŸ‘€ [CSS4 color functions](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/pull/42831) and [DisplayP3 color](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/pull/42830): More color options (e.g. Wide Gamut) coming to React Native.
- ğŸ¦ [Expo is dogfooding Expo web and Expo Router on their new blog](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1755026874047123843)

- ğŸ“– [Expo Docs - Build Expo apps for TV](https://x.com/expo/status/1754208200935518292?s=20): â€œReact Native everywhereâ€ is becoming more true every day. Thanks to Expo config plugins, experimental support for Apple TV and Android TV is now directly available. This is a super exciting development, which Iâ€™m sure will continue with macOS, visionOS, â€¦
- ğŸ“– [Improved Metro bundler docs from Expo](https://docs.expo.dev/guides/customizing-metro/): Explaining how bundle splitting, tree shaking, and minification work and and how Metro is now also used for the web.
- ğŸ“œ [What every dev should know about using Environment Variables](https://expo.dev/blog/what-are-environment-variables): Handling environment variables in RN correctly is critical, as you otherwise run the risk of shipping (and therefore exposing) secrets to the client.
- ğŸ“œ [Fingerprint your native runtime with @expo/fingerprint](https://expo.dev/blog/fingerprint-your-native-runtime): Determining whether an update to the JS bundle of a RN app requires a new native build is a tricky question. With SDK 50, Expo released Fingerprint, which basically creates a single hash value representing all the â€œnative surface areaâ€ of a RN app and can then be used to trigger a new native build.
- ğŸ“œ [6 reasons to use EAS Update](https://expo.dev/blog/6-reasons-to-use-eas-update): Did you know about the republish feature? I didnâ€™t, before reading this article. In case of a messed up upgrade, you can quickly republish a previous (working) update!
- ğŸ“œ [How to add a new target to your file with Expo config plugin?](https://www.reactnativecrossroads.com/posts/config-plugin-expo-add-target)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Native Storybook 7 - CSF 3, TypeScript, Markdown, Automatic story loading, Auto-generation for controls](https://storybook.js.org/blog/react-native-storybook-7/)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Native Test App 3.1 - Support for bridgeless mode](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-test-app/releases/tag/3.1.0)
- ğŸ¥ [William Candillon - JavaScript Animations in 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AHh3Bt7JpRs): The next version of Reanimated will support JavaScript generators. William rewrites 3 of his custom Reanimated animation examples to generators, using yields in a while (true) loop.
- ğŸ¥ [Simon Grimm - The Time for React Native is Now](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COH_XhlMyZ4)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [RNR 287 - Special Guest - Charlie Cheever](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-287-special-guest-charlie-cheever): To me it was always clear that Expo was meant to be a layer on top of React Native. But did you know that Charlie Cheever and James Ide started working on Expo before React Native was even around?
